properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 8 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
Snow is going to move into the High Country of North Carolina,
north into the Grayson Highlands this afternoon, as well as the
foothills of North Carolina. Look for 1 to 2 inches to accumulate
from the Tennessee border in North Carolina to the Blue Ridge,
mainly south of Jefferson and Sparta, with a dusting to an inch
elsewhere. Locally higher amounts to 3 inches could occur at Beech
Mountain.

Temperatures will struggle to reach above freezing this afternoon
in the mountains, so any snow that falls will likely lead to slick
spots on roadways. If traveling, reduce your speed and watch for
poor visibility at times. The snow should be tapering off between
5pm and 7pm.

NWSheadline: PERIOD OF LIGHT SNOW THIS AFTERNOON MAY IMPACT TRAVEL
